Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: DUAL SERVICE MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT FOR EMPLOYEE SERVICES Chattanooga State Technical Community College VENDOR PARTY Tennessee Board of Regents PROCURING PARTY This memorandum signifies agreement of the above parties concerning the provision of employee services. The agreement is as follows: 1 .Vendor agrees to furnish the services of its employee: Name of Employee: Shirley Anne Kilgore_______________________________________________ Social Security No. i_____ ^ Address/ City / zip code:PO Box 643, Whitwell, TN 37397 email: shirley.kilgore@chattanoogastate.edu Phone: 423-493-8722_________________________ who will perform the following services for procuring party : Tennessee Board of Regents Description of Services: Program Mentor for AASN-RODP - (See attached job description) 2. Compensation to vendor party (includes cost of any applicable staff benefits to vendor's employee for service under this agreement) Summer II, 2008: $1,100.00 base pay plus $68.20 FICA @ 6.2%, $15.95 Medicare @ 1.45%, $110..00 retirement @ 10% (ORP) = $1,294,15 plus travel not to exceed $280.00 (Travel to be paid in accordance with the current TBR Travel Policy 4:03:03:00) for a total not to exceed $1,574.15. Fall 2008: $2.200.00 base pay plus $136.40 FICA @ 6.2%, $31.90 Medicare @ 1.45%, $220.00 retirement @ 10% (ORP) = $2,588.30 plus travel not to exceed $280.00 (Travel to be paid in accordance with the current TBR Travel Policy 4:03:03:00) for a total not to exceed $2,868.30. Spring 2009: $2,200.00 base pay plus $ 136.40 FICA @ 6.2%, $31.90 Medicare @ 1.45%, $220.00 retirement @ 10% (ORP) = $2,588.30 plus travel not to exceed $280.00 (Travel to be paid in accordance with the current TBR Travel Policy 4:03:03:00) for a total not to exceed $2,868.30. Summer I, 2009: $1,100.00 base pay plus $68.20 FICA @ 6.2%, $15.95 Medicare @ 1.45%, $110.00 retirement @ 10%(ORP)= $1,294.15. Maximum liability of procuring party $8,604.90 of contract. 3. Payment will be made by procuring party after completion of service and after receipt of invoice from vendor party mailed to the following address: Deanna Hall, Director of Fiscal Services 1415 Murfreesboro Rd., Suite 350 Nashville, TN 37217-2833 Payment will be made in four (4) installments; 1st Installment (Summer II, 2008) due on or after Aug. 13,2008 2nd Installment (Fall 2008) due on or after Dec. 11,2008 3rd Installment (Spring 2009) due on or after April 30,2009 4th Installment (Summer 1,2009) due on or after June 29,2009 4. Contract time and term: July 1,2008 - June 30,2009 5. Either party may terminate this agreement by giving written notice to the other at least 30 days before the effective date of termination. In that event, vendor shall be entitled to receive just and equitable compensation for any satisfactory work completed as of the termination date. In addition, procuring party shall have the right to immediately terminate this agreement and withhold payments in excess of fair compensation for work completed in the event that the employee fails to perform in a timely and proper manner or breaches any material term of this agreement. 6. This agreement cannot be assigned or subcontracted without the written consent of all parties. Dated this 14th day of May, 2008. CHATTANOOGA STATE ?AL COMMUNITY COLLEGE TENNESSEE BOARD OF REGENTS By: Date:
